instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PP3V3_S4_IPD: What is PP3V3_S4_IPD? PP3V3_S4_IPD is a 3.3v power rail for powering the trackpad and keyboard on a Macbook Air. If the keyboard and trackpad are not powering, check the resistor that functions as a fuse between PP3V3_S4 and PP3V3_S4_IPD as it may have blown. .
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad and keyboard not work
threads.message:
Hi i have this board who don't find trackpad and keyboard.
I try new one trackpad same problem, no liquid spill, no trace very clean.
the customer say, trackpad work & sometimes not. now not work all the time :)
i find <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_IPD</SIGNAL> = 2V is too low, if i compare with another board.
i find <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> on <CAPACITOR>C5560</CAPACITOR> =3v3 but  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> on <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR> = 2V (with & without the trackpad), <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>=0ohm.
why it <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is different? normally is the same on all the board no?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad and keyboard not work
threads.message: Should of course be 3V3 on <RESISTOR>R4830</RESISTOR>. Sounds like a bad trace to me, run a wire to the nearest <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad and keyboard not work
threads.message:
Sorry but <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> is different of <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>?
who is create <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> because when i put a wire between this signal, all fall at 2V, after some minutes, the keyboard work at start after 1 minute, stop working.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad and keyboard not work
threads.message: <CHIP>U8050</CHIP> may be bad then if <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is low everywhere on the board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad and keyboard not work
threads.message: i find the problem is <RESISTOR>R8115</RESISTOR> is dead, i change it and keyboard & trackpad work well.
